summary: Email correspondence between attorney Gloria Allred and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding a scheduled court conference on August 27, 2019, to discuss the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death. The AUSA offers to arrange travel for victims who wish to attend the conference but cannot afford travel costs.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office offered to arrange and pay for travel for Epstein victims to attend a court conference regarding the dismissal of the indictment, regardless of whether they had previously spoken to prosecutors.
Judge Berman scheduled a conference for August 27, 2019, to address the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death.
The conference was intended to allow victims to be heard either directly or through their counsel during the proceeding.
The correspondence shows coordination between victim attorneys and prosecutors to facilitate victim participation in post-death legal proceedings.
